answer:
The Measles-Mumps-Rubella and Varicella Vaccine (MMRV) is only approved for ages 12 months - 12 years of age in Canada. The upper age limit of 12 years is based on previous studies on the immune response and safety from the manufacturer's of chickenpox (varicella) only vaccines. 12 years of age will remain the recommended upper age limit for the MMRV vaccine until data are available regarding MMRV use in older teens and adults. 
Immunization Nurse
answer_formatted:
## The Measles-Mumps-Rubella and Varicella Vaccine (MMRV) is only approved for ages 12 months - 12 years of age in Canada.

The upper age limit of 12 years is based on previous studies on the immune response and safety from the manufacturer's of chickenpox (varicella) only vaccines.

## 12 years of age will remain the recommended upper age limit for the MMRV vaccine until data are available regarding MMRV use in older teens and adults.

Immunization Nurse
question: Hi there - why is MMRV not approved to be used in clients over 13?
question_variation_1: when is mmrv not approved for use for clients over 13
question_variation_2: why is mmrv not approved to be used in clients over 13?
